items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTREDUCTION OF A PARTICULAR KIND OF SERVICERESOLUTION #2008/2009-32WHEREAS, the Superintendent of the East Side Union High School District (“District”), has recommended to the District’s Governing Board (“Board”) that the District reduce particular kinds of service no later than the beginning of the 2009-2010 school year; WHEREAS, the recommendation includes the assessment that it shall be necessary to reduce the following particular kinds of service of the District no later than the beginning of the 2009-2010 school year:Kind of Service Number of Full-Time Equivalent Positions (“FTEs”)Visual Arts6Business2English13Japanese 1Spanish8Vietnamese1Industrial Education2Math12Health1Child Care Center Instructor2Physical Education7Science11Social Science10Performing Arts2Teacher on Special Assignment1 Math RecoveryTeacher on Special Assignment1 WASCTotal FTEs80.0WHEREAS, the Governing Board is required by law to give notice, prior to March 15, 2009, to all certificated employees affected by any decision to reduce or eliminate this particular kind of service;IT IS RESOLVED THAT:A.	The Board hereby determines to reduce services as specified in the recommendation set forth in the recitals above, no later than the beginning of the 2009-2010 school year.B.	The Board hereby determines that, as the result of the above-stated reduction of particular kinds of service (the “Reduction in Force”), it will be necessary to terminate at the end of the 2008-2009 school year the employment of certificated employees of the District in a quantity and kind equal to the FTEs specified in the recommendation set forth in the recitals above.C.	In order to implement this Reduction in Force, it may be necessary to apply tie-breaking criteria to distinguish among certificated employees who first rendered paid probationary service to the District on the same date.  Pursuant to Education Code section 44955(b), the Board determines that the order of layoff as between employees who first rendered paid service to the District on the same date shall be established on the basis of the criteria set forth in Exhibit A to this Resolution, which are incorporated as though fully set forth herein.D.	The criteria set forth in Exhibit A to this Resolution shall also be used to determine the order of reemployment among those certificated employees who first rendered paid probationary service to the District on the same date.  The Superintendent, or his designee, has the discretion to determine the appropriate weight of such criteria and the order in which such criteria are most relevant to serve the needs of the District and students in each tie-breaking situation.E.	The Superintendent is directed to send appropriate notices to all employees affected by the above-described reduction of a particular kind of service in accordance with the provisions of the California Education Code, to take all necessary action to implement this Resolution, and to afford the employees all rights to which they are entitled under the law and applicable Collective Bargaining Agreement(s).    PASSED AND ADOPTED this 10th day of March, 2009.					BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT					By: ____________________________					       Patricia Martinez-Roach					       President of the Board of Trustees of					       The East Side Union High School District					By: ____________________________					       Frank Biehl					       Clerk of the Board of Trustees of					       The East Side Union High School District Exhibit ATIEBREAKING CRITERIA PURSUANT TO EDUCATION CODE SECTION 44955(b)Employees sharing the same first date of paid probationary service to the District shall be awarded tiebreaking points on the following basis:CriterionPointsPossession of credential(s) authorizing service for the District4 for each professional clear credential3 for each preliminary credential2 for intern credential1 for provisional internship permit or short-term staff permitPossession of Bilingual Cross-Cultural Language and Development certificate or its equivalent1Employees with a greater number of points shall be considered more senior than employees with a fewer number of points, for purposes of determining order of layoff and order of reemployment.If application of the foregoing criteria fails to resolve a tie among two or more employees, among the employees who remain tied the employee with the earliest date of issuance of a preliminary or professional clear credential shall be considered the more senior employee.  As among employees who remain tied who have never obtained a preliminary or professional clear credential, the employee with the earliest date of issuance of an intern credential shall be considered the more senior employee.  As among employees who remain tied who have never obtained an intern, preliminary, or professional clear credential, the employee with the earliest date of issuance of an emergency or pre-intern credential, provisional intern permit or short-term staff permit shall be considered the more senior employee.The Superintendent is authorized to determine the number of tiebreaking points to be awarded to each employee and to determine the manner in which the tiebreaking criteria shall be applied to each employee.CERTIFICATIONSTATE OF CALIFORNIA		)					)COUNTY OF SANTA CLARA	)I, Frank Biehl, Clerk of the Board of Trustees of the East Side Union High School District, do hereby certify that the foregoing Resolution was duly adopted by the Board of Trustees of the East Side Union High School District at a regular meeting held on the 10th day of March, 2009, and that it was so adopted by the following vote:AYES:NOES:ABSENT:ABSTAIN:							________________________________						Clerk of the Board of Trustees

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:Approve Recommendation for the Measures E & G Pre-Approved Construction Management Firms (CM) ListFollowing is the recommendation for the Measures E & G Pre-Approved Construction Management Firms (CM).  After an extensive evaluation of the proposals submitted, the following listed firms are recommended to provide construction management services for the duration of the district’s Measure G and E Bond Construction and Capital Improvement Program.  Each firm will be requested to submit a cost proposal on a per project basis:Blach Construction CompanyFacilities Management Planning and Operations - FMPOSGI Construction Management – Seville GroupO’Connor Construction ManagementThe District underwent a thorough Request for Statement of Qualification (RFQ) process (RFQ-02-08-09).  The RFQ was released on December 5, 2008 and closed on January 6, 2009.  The RFQ was advertised on December 5, 2008. The District received nine responsive and responsible proposals.  The first step in the evaluation process was to evaluate each of the nine proposals submitted to the District.  A committee was established and a rating sheet prepared for their evaluation of the written proposal.  The committee consisted of June Rono (Director of Facilities), Kathy Lanford (Assistant Director), Glenn VanderZee (Principal), and Chris Schroeder (Associate Principal). Six CM firms were then recommended to move forward to the oral interview based on the scores of the written proposal evaluation.  The oral interviews were conducted with the following panel members: John Sellarole (CBOC Member), Glenn VanderZee (Principal), Melissa Gonzales (KIPP Charter School Principal), Chris Schroeder (Associate Principal), Kathy Lanford (Assistant Director), June Rono (Director of Facilities) and Donna Bertrand (Contracts Admin. Coordinator).  All CM firms were scored on their presentations and responses to District questions.The third and final step in the evaluation process was to call the references.  The references were asked to rate the past performances of the six CM firms using a scale of 1-10. All of the scores were added together to form the final recommendation that would be taken to the Board of Trustee, which is presented herein. FISCAL IMPACT:To Be Determined by ProjectsFUNDING SOURCE:Measure E & Measure GRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the above recommended firms for the Measures E & G Pre-Approved Construction Management Firms (CM) List.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:Approve Recommendation for the Measures E & G Pre-Approved DSA Project Inspection Service/Inspector of Record (IOR) ListFollowing is the recommendation for the Measures E & G Pre-Approved DSA Project Inspection Service (IOR).  After an extensive evaluation of the proposals submitted, the following listed firms are recommended to provide DSA project inspections services for the duration of the district’s Measure G and E Bond Construction and Capital Improvement Program.  Each firm will be requested to submit a cost proposal on a per project basis:David F. Hall Inspections, Inc.Michael Henley & Co.Bruce Flyn & AssociatesThe District underwent a thorough Request for Statement of Qualification (RFQ) process (RFQ-03-08-09).  The RFQ was released on January 14, 2009 and closed on January 28, 2009.  The RFQ was advertised on January 13, 2008. The District received three responsive and responsible proposals.  The first step in the evaluation process was to evaluate each of the three proposals submitted to the District.  A committee was established and a rating sheet prepared for their evaluation of the written proposals.  The committee consisted of June Rono (Director of Facilities) and Kathy Lanford (Assistant Director). It was determined by the committee that all three of the firms received such high scores in the written proposals and that their proposals provided all of the necessary information that there was no need to hold the optional interviews.  Therefore, their recommendation was to move forward to the third and final step in the evaluation process which was to contact references.  References were contacted and asked to rate the past performances of the three IOR firms using a scale of 1-10. All of the scores were added together to form the final recommendation that would be taken to the Board of Trustee, which is presented herein. items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education StudentsDESCRIPTION: Education Code Section 60851 states that students who take one or both parts of the CAHSEE with a modification and receive the equivalent of a passing score are eligible for the waiver request process.  At the request of the student’s parent or guardian, a school principal must submit to the local school governing board a request for a waiver of the requirement to pass the part(s) of the CAHSEE on which a modification was used and the equivalent of a passing score was earned.  For the local board to waive the CAHSEE requirement, the principal must certify to the local board that the pupil has all of the following:1)	An individualized education program adopted pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act or a plan adopted pursuant to Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 that requires the accommodations or modifications to be provided to the pupil when taking the high school exit examination.2)	Sufficient high school level coursework either satisfactorily completed or in progress in a high school level curriculum sufficient to have attained the skills and knowledge otherwise needed to pass the high school exit examination.3)	An individual score report for the pupil showing that the pupil has received the equivalent of a passing score on the high school exit examination while using a modification that fundamentally alters what the high school exit examination measures as determined by the State Board of Education.The waivers were requested by the school site administration on behalf of the students’ parents.The recommended waivers meet the aforementioned criteria delineated in Education Code Section 60851: Student A	Student B	Student C	Student D	Student E	Student FStudent G	Student H	Student I	Student J	Student K	FISCAL IMPACT:NoneFUNDING SOURCE:NoneRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the recommended waivers.
